intro: Artanthe cassinoides, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking orange to red petals and delicate foliage. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a taproot system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Artanthe cassinoides is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
